jcr:root.definition: An institution for magical education, reputed to be the best school of its kind in the world. Hogwarts is in a secret location somewhere in the north of Britain, founded more than a thousand years ago by the four greatest witches and wizards of the age: Godric Gryffindor, Helga Hufflepuff, Rowena Ravenclaw, and Salazar Slytherin. Pupils attend from age eleven for seven years of rigorous training in the art of witchcraft and wizardry.
jcr:root.term: Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry.
